qas.question: What was unique about Odeon's 1909 release of the Nutcracker Suite?

answers.text: 4 double-sided discs in a specially designed package

qas.question: What was one of the first releases with a photo on the cover?
When were albums said to be pioneered?
What was one of the very first albums released?

context: German record company Odeon is often said to have pioneered the album in <a2_0>1909<a2_0/> when it released the <a3_0>Nutcracker Suite by Tchaikovsky<a3_0/> on <a0_0>4 double-sided discs in a specially designed package<a0_0/>. (It is not indicated what size the records are.) However, Deutsche Grammophon had produced an album for its complete recording of the opera Carmen in the previous year. The practice of issuing albums does not seem to have been widely taken up by other record companies for many years; however, HMV provided an album, with a pictorial cover, for the 1917 recording of <a1_0>The Mikado (Gilbert & Sullivan)<a1_0/>.
